title: SB 1.19.24 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 27-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: please after proper deliberation tell me of the unalloyed duty of everyone in all circumstances and specifically of those who are just about to die
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of discussion: Parikshit Maharaj's questions about duty, both general and specifically for those about to die.

segments.key_quote: mind you these are the most important questions anybody can ask with regard to uh spirituality
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of Parikshit's questions and draws a parallel to Arjuna's inquiries in the Bhagavad Gita.

segments.key_quote: what is the specific duty of one who is to die very shortly was about to die what is his duty
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates Parikshit's specific concern about his duty given his impending death in seven days.

segments.key_quote: of the two the question relating to the dying man is most important because everyone is a dying man either very shortly or after 100 years
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the importance of the question about the dying man's duty, noting that everyone is ultimately a dying man, and connects it to the broader discussion of duty in the Bhagavad Gita.

segments.key_quote: practically the whole of the shreemad bhagavatam beginning from the second canto up to the last twelfth canto deal with these two questions so important these questions are
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the entirety of the Srimad Bhagavatam addresses the two questions posed by Parikshit Maharaj.

segments.key_quote: The permanent duty of everyone is to render service to Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the conclusion of the Bhagavatam is that the permanent duty of everyone is to render devotional service to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: So that he might be able to go on with his confirmed duty without controversy. See Pariksit is taking a very humble position.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Parikshit, despite being a devotee, seeks confirmation from the assembled sages out of humility and respect for authority.

segments.key_quote: the first class method demands that one give up all other methods and surrender onto the lotus feet of the lord and thus be safe on all sin and their sins.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses different methods of transcendental realization, highlighting bhakti yoga as the first-class method involving surrender to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: yuktatama means is most intimately united with me in yoga who the one who with devotion faith renders devotional service to me
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by quoting Krishna from the Bhagavad Gita, certifying that bhakti yoga is the topmost yoga and that a devotee is the most intimately connected with Krishna.
